page.title: 10RUMBLING STREET
page.content: RUMBLING STREET IS SITUATED ON AN OLD ROMAN ROAD AND WAS PART OF THE LEAD ROUTE FROM DERBYSHIRE TO BAWTRY WHICH AT THAT TIME WAS AN INLAND PORT.THE LEAD WAS LOADED AT BAWTRY AND EXPORTED.RUMBLING STREET IS NOW APPROXIMATELY FOUR METRES WIDE.ONLY TWO HOUSES HAVE SURVIVED AND ELEVEN PEOPLE LIVE THERE.FIFTY SEVEN PEOPLE USED TO LIVE IN RUMBLING STREET IN FARM COTTAGES BUT NOW THESE ARE USED AS BARNS FOR THE FARM.IT IS 14TH CENTURY IN ORIGIN AND HAS EIGHTY SEVEN ACRES.IT IS A MIXED FARM WITH CATTLE, SHEEP AND CROP GROWING.THE FARM HAS A VERY INTERESTING CRUCK BARN WHICH IS STILL IN USE.THE CRUCK BARN HAS A BLUE SLATE ROOF AS THE ORIGINAL WAS BLOWN OFF BY A LAND MINE IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR.
